The lithologic change reflects the sedimentation to a certain extent___________ Changes, while deposition___________ The change of the earth's crust is often closely related to the crustal movement. testCases.actualOutput: When dividing the strata of a region, it is generally to establish a stratigraphic section. All sections with complete stratigraphic exposure, normal sequence, clear contact relationship and well preserved fossils can be used as stratigraphic section. If it is marine strata, it often shows repeated changes of lithofacies from coarse to fine and from fine to coarse. Such a change is called a sedimentary cycle, That is, each set of transgressive horizon and regressive horizon constitutes a complete sedimentary cycle. Strata can also be divided according to lithology. The lithologic change reflects the sedimentation to a certain extent geological changes, while deposition reflects the change of the earth's crust is often closely related to the crustal movement.
